Proof

AWESOMENESS!!! Thanks so much!!!

PS: You might wanna look at the Inon Adapter decoupler (Still says centaur in description)

There's bound to be bugs, as it seems like there wasn't much testing done before release... As I've noticed from 5 minutes of gameplay:

-The booster engines are sill too far in.

-The vernier's flame effect is still a smidge too high.

-What Davidy12 mentioned~

-The sustainer has a minimum thrust of like 100(So you can't shut it down with throttle; I don't think it's supposed to do that...)

-The little box on the sustainer adapter tank clips through the booster engine fairing (That just irks me :c)

Other than that A+ work once again, my friend.

Edit: Davidy12 ninja'd me on the sustainer min. throttle...
Same with verniers
The throttle behavior was somewhat intentional but I'll remove it. Good thing I set aside tomorrow morning to big fix haha
Easy fix. I fixed it min thrust. Goodnight buddy!
Aaayyyeee, I was there last night. ( ÃÂ¡Ã‚Â° ÃÅ“ÃŠâ€“ ÃÂ¡Ã‚Â°)

The only thing I remember is ravioli...

It was one heck of a stream...

Updated, fixed some bugs. I cannot for the life of me get the thrust fx to offset correctly on the vernier. But I figure it isn't game breaking and won't break saves once I get a fix. My primary concern is just getting something out. I'll have time to put out another hotfix before next week so please report any more problems.

Cheers!

EDIT: Also, Kerbalstuff won't update soooo yeah

Paging /u/Beale... wait, crap.

I'll ask about it.

1.5m turned out to be a very handy size for some things, like the Gemini capsule diameter and the Soyuz radial booster diameter. Even though it is very non-standard, it does fill some gaps in craft designs that cannot be filled otherwise.

Curtquarquesso is the expert on its applications though

1.5m turned out to be a very handy size for some things, like the Gemini capsule diameter and the Soyuz radial booster diameter. Even though it is very non-standard, it does fill some gaps in craft designs that cannot be filled otherwise.

Curtquarquesso is the expert on its applications though

Hmm I feel far less restricted in adding stuff in that size category now.

Hmm I feel far less restricted in adding stuff in that size category now.

I think any size factor is fine, as long as adapters to common sizes are provided and the size is fully 'fleshed-out' (Though I am being a little hypocritical nevery having flushed-out the 0.9375m size).

If it works for you, use it!

Here's a 1.5m Gemini for example. The size is only very minor bigger than 1.25m, but enough to be notice-able.

It is worth noting, I never have adopted 1.5m in the end, but it is good for Tweakscale.

Edited November 5, 2015 by Beale

Yay for 1.5m Thor!

I think any size factor is fine, as long as adapters to common sizes are provided and the size is fully 'fleshed-out' (Though I am being a little hypocritical nevery having flushed-out the 0.9375m size).

If it works for you, use it!

Yeah that's sort of the way I'm leaning. If it makes you feel any better, Venom has been working on a .9375m Ablestar-inspired upper stage.
